Just an FYI!
I wonder when is going to become available for this new OS Release of Ubuntu.

Steps to reproduce
------------------
I had to try the following:
```powershell
sudo curl https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc | sudo apt-key add -

sudo curl -o /etc/apt/sources.list.d/microsoft.list https://packages.microsoft.com/config/ubuntu/18.04/prod.list

sudo apt update 

sudo apt-get install -y powershell
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
To install PowerShell Core.
```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
It can't find the package.
```none
:
Reading state information... Done
E: Unable to locate package powershell

```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```UbuntuOS
maxt@ubuntu:~$ cat /etc/os-release
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="18.04 LTS (Bionic Beaver)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 18.04 LTS"
VERSION_ID="18.04"
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
VERSION_CODENAME=bionic
UBUNTU_CODENAME=bionic
maxt@ubuntu:~$ 

```

comments.author: rjmholt
comments.body:
That one should be coming soon. For now, it will work by installing `libssl1.0.0` and `libicu60` along with the other Linux dependencies and then [installing the binary archive](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/setup/installing-powershell-core-on-linux?view=powershell-6#linux).

We actually [already have the packaging done for Ubuntu 18.04](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/tools/packaging/packaging.psm1#L998), the remaining work is publishing the repo.

title: PSCore6 - Not available for Ubuntu version 18.04 Bionic Beaver Release
